Package space.sunqian.fs.reflect

Class ClassKit

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.reflect.ClassKit
public class ClassKit extends Object
Utilities for Class.

  • Method Details

    • getField

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Field getField(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name)
      Returns the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getField(String). If not found, it will use Class.getDeclaredField(String) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified field name
      Returns:
      the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found

    • getField

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Field getField(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name, boolean searchDeclared)
      Returns the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getField(String). If not found and the searchDeclared is true, it will use Class.getDeclaredField(String) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified field name
      searchDeclared - specifies whether searches declared fields
      Returns:
      the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found

    • searchField

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Field searchField(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name)
      Returns the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found.

      This method searches via Class.getField(String). If the field is not found, then this method will use Class.getDeclaredField(String) to search again. If the field is still not found, then this method will traverse the hierarchy of superclasses and interfaces of the given class to search via Class.getDeclaredField(String).

      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified field name
      Returns:
      the field of the specified name from the given class, or null if not found

    • getMethod

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Method getMethod(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] parameterTypes)
      Returns the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getMethod(String, Class[]). If not found, it will use Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class[]) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified method name
      parameterTypes - the specified parameter types
      Returns:
      the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found

    • getMethod

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Method getMethod(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] parameterTypes, boolean searchDeclared)
      Returns the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getMethod(String, Class[]). If not found and the searchDeclared is true, it will use Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class[]) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified method name
      parameterTypes - the specified parameter types
      searchDeclared - specifies whether searches declared methods
      Returns:
      the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found

    • searchMethod

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Method searchMethod(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull String name, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] parameterTypes)
      Returns the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found.

      This method searches via Class.getMethod(String, Class[]). If the method is not found, then this method will use Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class[]) to search again. If the method is still not found, then this method will traverse the hierarchy of superclasses and interfaces of the given class to search via Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class[]).

      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      name - the specified method name
      parameterTypes - the specified parameter types
      Returns:
      the method of the specified name and parameter types from the given class, or null if not found

    • getConstructor

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Constructor<?> getConstructor(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] parameterTypes)
      Returns the constructor of the specified parameter types from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getConstructor(Class[]). If not found, it will use Class.getDeclaredConstructor(Class[]) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      parameterTypes - the specified parameter types
      Returns:
      the constructor of the specified parameter types from the given class, or null if not found

    • getConstructor

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Constructor<?> getConstructor(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> cls, @Nonnull @Nonnull Class<?> @Nonnull @RetainedParam [] parameterTypes, boolean searchDeclared)
      Returns the constructor of the specified parameter types from the given class, or null if not found. This method first uses Class.getConstructor(Class[]). If not found and the searchDeclared is true, it will use Class.getDeclaredConstructor(Class[]) to try again.
      Parameters:
      cls - the given class
      parameterTypes - the specified parameter types
      searchDeclared - specifies whether searches declared constructors
      Returns:
      the constructor of the specified parameter types from the given class, or null if not found

    • newInstance

      @Nullable public static <T> T newInstance(@Nonnull @Nonnull String className)
      Returns a new instance for the given class name with the empty constructor, may be null if fails.

      This method first uses classForName(String, ClassLoader) to get the class of the given class name, then call newInstance(Class) to create a new instance.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the instance's type
      Parameters:
      className - the given class name
      Returns:
      a new instance for the given class name with the empty constructor, may be null if fails

    • newInstance

      @Nullable public static <T> T newInstance(@Nonnull @Nonnull String className, @Nullable @Nullable ClassLoader loader)
      Returns a new instance for the given class name with the empty constructor, may be null if fails.

      This method first uses classForName(String, ClassLoader) to get the class of the given class name, then call newInstance(Class) to create a new instance.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the instance's type
      Parameters:
      className - the given class name
      loader - the given class loader, may be null if loaded by the default loader
      Returns:
      a new instance for the given class name with the empty constructor, may be null if fails

    • classForName

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Class<?> classForName(@Nonnull @Nonnull String name)
      Returns the Class object whose name is the given name. This method is equivalent to classForName(name, null).
      Parameters:
      name - the given name of the class or interface
      Returns:
      the Class object whose name is the given name, or null if loading fails
      See Also:
      • classForName(String, ClassLoader)

    • classForName

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Class<?> classForName(@Nonnull @Nonnull String name, @Nullable @Nullable ClassLoader loader)
      Returns the Class object whose name is the given name. This method calls Class.forName(String) if the given class loader is null, or Class.forName(String, boolean, ClassLoader) if not.
      Parameters:
      name - the given name of the class or interface
      loader - the given class loader, may be null
      Returns:
      the Class object whose name is the given name, or null if loading fails
